title: SunRaysEffect
content:
This file is automatically generated. Please don't edit it manually.

name: SunRaysEffect
type: class
memorycategory: Instances
summary: |
  Renders dynamic rays from the sun.
description: |
  The SunRaysEffect renders a halo of light around sun. The halo is
  shaped/blocked by world objects between the Class.Workspace.CurrentCamera
  and the sun.

  Like other post-processing effects, SunRaysEffect will only work while
  Class.PostEffect.Enabled|Enabled and when parented to Class.Lighting or
  Class.Workspace.CurrentCamera. Also, it may not render on low-end devices,
  and it may render differently depending on your Studio settings (see the
  Quality Level settings in Rendering → Performance).

  For more details on this effect and others, see
  Post-Processing Effects.
codesamples: []
inherits:
  - PostEffect
descendants: []
tags: []
deprecationmessage: ''
properties:
  - name: SunRaysEffect.Intensity
    summary: |
      Determines the opacity of the sun rays.
    description: |
      Intensity determines the opacity of the sun rays. Values closer to 0 are
      less visible, while values closer to 1 become more visible.
    codesamples: []
    type: float
    tags: []
    deprecationmessage: ''
    security:
      read: None
      write: None
    threadsafety: ReadSafe
    category: State
    serialization:
      canload: true
      cansave: true
    capabilities:
      - Environment
  - name: SunRaysEffect.Spread
    summary: |
      Determines how wide the sun rays will spread out.
    description: |
      Spread determines how wide the sun rays will spread across the sky. Its
      value should be set between 0 and 1 as values outside that range have
      undefined behavior.
    codesamples: []
    type: float
    tags: []

    security:

      write: None
    threadsafety: ReadSafe
    category: State
    serialization:
      canload: true

    capabilities:
      - Environment
